questions.question: Kinetic and potential energy are two types of energy that relate to ______________ .

choices.answer: Change
Friction
Density
Motion

questions.question: Which of these has the most potential energy?

choices.answer: A man on top of the hill
A man on the bottom of the hill
A car on top of the hill
A car on the bottom of the hill

questions.question: What is potential energy?

choices.answer: The stored energy of an object due to its position or condition
The energy that an object has due to its motion
The energy an object has due to its speed
The energy an object has due to its volume

questions.question: What is kinetic energy?

choices.answer: The stored energy of an object due to its position or condition
The energy that an object has due to its motion
The energy an object has due to its existence
The energy an object has due to its volume

questions.question: Which person has the most potential energy?

choices.answer: Everybody has equal potential energy
The skier going down the hill
The first person about to get off the ski lift
The last person to get off the ski lift

questions.question: The amount of kinetic energy an object has depends on its:

choices.answer: mass and volume
volume and friction
mass and speed
speed and density

questions.question: Which of the following has the most kinetic energy?

choices.answer: A car traveling at 80 kph
A tractor-trailer traveling at 80 kph
A cheetah running at 80 kph
A motorcycle traveling at 80 kph

questions.question: When is kinetic energy transferred from object to object?

choices.answer: When those objects pass one another
When the first object outweighs the second object
When the first object has more potential energy than the second object
When those objects collide

questions.question: In a generator, kinetic energy is transformed into:

choices.answer: motion
potential energy
electricity
solar power

questions.question: There is a finite amount of energy in the universe. What does this mean?

choices.answer: Energy is created and destroyed all the time
There is a limited amount of energy in the universe
Stars generate most of the energy in the universe
Dark matter absorbs most of the energy in the universe

questions.question: Let's try again. What is potential energy?

choices.answer: The energy an object has due to its position or condition
The energy an object has due to its motion
The energy an object has due to its chemical composition
The energy an object has due to its atomic structure

questions.question: So... What is kinetic energy again?

choices.answer: The energy an object has due to its position or condition
The energy an object has due to its motion
The energy an object has due to its chemical composition
The energy an object has due to its atomic structure

questions.question: When does an object have NO kinetic energy?

choices.answer: When it's at rest
When it's moving very slowly
When the only force that's acting on it is gravity
When it has no electrical charge

questions.question: What object has the most potential energy?

choices.answer: A ball resting on the ground
A ball being thrown at 100 miles per hour
A ball on top of a refrigerator
A ball resting on the edge of a cliff

questions.question: When does a yo-yo have the most potential energy?

choices.answer: When it's at its highest point
When it's at its lowest point
When it's moving between its highest and lowest points
When it's moving at its top speed

questions.question: When is potential energy transformed into kinetic energy?

choices.answer: When an object at rest is lifted to a higher level
When an object at rest remains at rest
When an object at rest is put into motion
When an object in motion is stopped and put at rest

questions.question: What do potential and kinetic energy have in common?

choices.answer: They are both related to density.
They are both unrelated to mass.
They are both related to volume.
They are both related to motion.

questions.question: Four items are positioned at the top of the hill. Which item has the most potential energy?

choices.answer: soccer ball
tricycle
school bus
Ms. Matsui's SUV

questions.question: Which is the best synonym for potential energy?

choices.answer: Stored energy
Energy of motion
Energy due to gravity
Mechanical energy

questions.question: Why do objects at high elevations have more potential energy than objects at low elevations?

choices.answer: Thinner air at higher elevations means objects will move faster
Objects at high elevations are closer to the sun, our energy source
Objects at high elevations tend to move slower than low elevations
Gravity gives objects at high elevations the potential to fall much further
